alert.note: Alert for Boone; Braxton; Cabell; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Lincoln; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Roane; Upshur; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:47AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lawrence, Calhoun, Kanawha, Putnam, west central Upshur, Lincoln, Roane, north central Wyoming, southeastern Jackson, southeastern Wayne, southeastern Cabell, northwestern Nicholas, northwestern Mingo, southern Gilmer, southeastern Lewis, Braxton, northwestern Raleigh, Logan, Clay, northwestern Fayette and Boone Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 446 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arnoldsburg to Hode. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Spencer, Winfield, Logan, Hamlin, Sutton, Clay, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Eleanor, Marmet and Belle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 84. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 131. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 33 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 62 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 80. Route 19 between mile markers 53 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Braxton; Cabell; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Lincoln; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Roane; Upshur; Wayne
